tasks.title: Establish Flake Structure and System Builders
tasks.description: Create the foundational Nix flake structure with system builders for both NixOS and Darwin platforms
tasks.details:
1. Create a `flake.nix` file at the root of the repository that defines inputs (nixpkgs, home-manager, darwin, etc.)
2. Implement `lib/mkSystem.nix` with functions to build configurations for both NixOS and Darwin
3. Set up a basic directory structure:
   - hosts/: For host-specific configurations
   - modules/: For shared modules (common, nixos, darwin)
   - home/: For Home Manager configurations
   - overlays/: For package modifications
   - pkgs/: For custom packages
4. Create a simple argument passing system for dependency injection between modules
5. Implement basic validation to catch configuration errors
6. Ensure the flake builds successfully with `nix flake check`
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify flake evaluation with `nix flake check`
2. Test building a minimal NixOS configuration
3. Test building a minimal Darwin configuration
4. Validate directory structure follows the planned architecture
5. Ensure proper error messages are displayed for common configuration mistakes

tasks.title: Implement Modular Configuration System
tasks.description: Create a layered module system with clear separation of concerns between common, platform-specific, and host-specific configurations
tasks.details:
1. Design a module structure with three layers:
   - Common modules (shared across all systems)
   - Platform-specific modules (NixOS vs Darwin)
   - Host-specific configurations
2. Create standard module interfaces with options and config attributes
3. Implement module composition logic in `lib/mkSystem.nix`
4. Set up inheritance patterns for configuration values
5. Create helper functions for common configuration patterns
6. Implement conditional module loading based on system type
7. Document the module system architecture and usage patterns
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Create test modules for each layer and verify proper inheritance
2. Test platform-specific module loading on different system types
3. Verify that common configurations are properly applied across platforms
4. Test module composition with conflicting configurations to ensure proper resolution
5. Validate that helper functions produce expected configuration outputs

tasks.details:

3. Configure client-side integration:
   - Add Attic cache to substituters in Nix configuration
   - Configure trusted public keys for all clients
   - Set up appropriate bandwidth and connection limits
   - Implement fallback to official cache for missing packages

4. Implement automated cache population:
   - Configure CI/CD pipeline to push built derivations to the cache
   - Set up post-build hooks to automatically push local builds
   - Create policies for which derivations should be cached

5. Optimize cache performance:

   - Tune network parameters for optimal throughput
   - Implement request rate limiting to prevent overload
   - Set up caching headers for improved performance

6. Document cache usage and maintenance:

   - Create a central backup module in the NixOS configuration
   - Implement service-specific backup hooks for each stateful service
   - Configure automated, scheduled backups with retention policies

3. Implement AdGuard Home backup solution:
   - Create a backup script that preserves AdGuard configuration and statistics
   - Ensure backup captures both /var/lib/AdGuardHome and runtime configuration

   - Test restore procedures in isolation to verify effectiveness

6. Implement backup rotation and pruning:

   - Implement secure cleanup of expired backups

7. Create disaster recovery documentation:
   - Step-by-step recovery procedures for each critical service

tasks.title: Implement ZFS + Restic Backup System with Systemd Orchestration

tasks.details:

   - Implement `modules/nixos/backup.nix` with the main orchestration logic
   - Create `lib/backup-helpers.nix` with the `mkResticBackup` function for generating service-specific backup configurations
   - Define the systemd target chain: pre-backup-tasks.target → zfs-snapshot.service → restic-backup.target → post-backup-tasks.target

2. Implement ZFS snapshot functionality:
   - Configure daily ZFS snapshots at 2:00 AM for crash-consistent state
   - Set up snapshot naming conventions and retention policies
   - Create mount points for snapshots to ensure backups run from snapshots, not live filesystems

3. Configure Restic backup system:
   - Set up repository initialization and configuration
   - Implement encryption and compression settings
   - Configure both local (NAS) and remote (Cloudflare R2/B2) destinations
   - Set up proper retention policies (daily, weekly, monthly)

4. Create service-specific backup configurations:

   - 1Password Connect: Configuration and data directory backups
   - Attic: Binary cache data backup with consistency checks
   - Omada: Controller database and configuration backups

5. Implement monitoring and notification system:
   - Integrate with Healthchecks.io for backup success/failure monitoring
   - Configure ntfy.sh notifications for backup status alerts
   - Set up logging with structured output for easier debugging

6. Create documentation and restore procedures:
   - Document the complete backup architecture
   - Create step-by-step restore guides for each service
   - Implement restore helper scripts for common recovery scenarios
   - Document disaster recovery procedures

7. Implement backup verification:
   - Add automated integrity checks for backups
   - Create test restore procedures that validate backup completeness

2. Test Restic backup operations:

tasks.details:

     - `x86_64-generic.nix` for luna and rydev
     - `rpi4.nix` for nixpi
   - Create `hosts/profiles/roles/` directory with:
     - `server.nix` for SSH, users, and firewall configurations
     - `container-host.nix` for Podman setup
     - `reverse-proxy.nix` for Caddy/HAProxy configurations
     - `dns.nix` for AdGuard/Bind configurations

   - Implement `container-host.nix` with Podman/container runtime configurations
   - Build `reverse-proxy.nix` with Caddy/HAProxy settings and common proxy patterns
   - Develop `dns.nix` with AdGuard/Bind configurations and DNS management

4. Refactor existing host configurations:
   - Modify luna configuration to import and compose profiles instead of direct configuration
   - Update rydev to use the same profile-based approach
   - Ensure nixpi uses the rpi4 hardware profile
   - Preserve host-specific customizations while leveraging shared profiles

5. Implement profile composition mechanism:
   - Create helper functions in `lib/` for combining profiles with host-specific overrides
   - Ensure profiles can be composed without conflicts
   - Implement a clean API for importing profiles in host configurations

6. Preserve existing functionality:

   - Ensure service integrations continue to work

7. Document the new architecture:
   - Create README.md in the profiles directory explaining the design

tasks.title: Implement NixOS Operational Safety Warnings and Monitoring System
tasks.description: Create a comprehensive warning and monitoring system for NixOS configurations that alerts on critical misconfigurations and integrates with existing backup and security systems.
tasks.details:
1. Implement the core warning system module:
   - Create `modules/nixos/warnings.nix` to centralize warning definitions
   - Implement using NixOS `warnings` list in the module system
   - Define warning categories: security, backup, monitoring, configuration
   - Add conditional warnings based on system purpose (production vs. development)

2. Implement specific warning checks:
   - Backup status warnings:
     ```nix
     (mkIf (!cfg.backup.enable && config.mySystem.purpose != "Development") 
       "WARNING: Backups are disabled on production host ${config.networking.hostName}!")
     ```
   - Security configuration warnings:
     ```nix
     (mkIf (!config.networking.firewall.enable && config.mySystem.purpose != "Development")
       "WARNING: Firewall is disabled on production host ${config.networking.hostName}!")
     (mkIf (config.services.openssh.permitRootLogin != "no")
       "WARNING: Root SSH login is not explicitly disabled!")
     ```
   - Monitoring service warnings:
     ```nix
     (mkIf (!config.services.prometheus.enable && config.mySystem.purpose != "Development")
       "WARNING: Prometheus monitoring is disabled on production host!")
     ```
   - Service-specific warnings for critical services
